summary: This is an affidavit filed by defense attorney Christian R. Everdell in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, certifying that defense counsel has conferred with prosecutors regarding the disclosure of the identities of Victims 1-3 referenced in the indictment. The government declined to provide the identities at that time, stating it would do so through discovery or Jencks Act material closer to trial.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Partner at Cohen & Gresser LLP, counsel for defendant Ghislaine Maxwell, who filed this affidavit certifying good faith conferral with prosecutors regarding disclosure of victim identities.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20 Cr. 330), for whom Christian R. Everdell serves as counsel.

connections.description: Everdell is a partner at Cohen & Gresser LLP and serves as defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell in her criminal case.

events.title: Filing of Affidavit of Certification
events.description: Defense attorney Christian R. Everdell files an affidavit certifying that defense counsel has conferred with Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding the disclosure of the identities of Victims 1-3.

locations: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK
800 Third Avenue New York, New York 10022
keyFacts: Defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell requested the disclosure of the identities of Victims 1-3 referenced in the indictment.
The government (Assistant U.S. Attorneys) did not agree to the request and indicated it would disclose the identities through Rule 16 discovery or Jencks Act material closer to trial.
The affidavit certifies that the defense's request was made in good faith consultation with prosecutors, as required by Local Criminal Rule 16.1.
The document is part of Case 1:20-cr-00330-AJN, indicating it is from Ghislaine Maxwell's 2020 criminal prosecution.
